title: Blue Sky alumni keep on truckin'
text:
Welcome back to Where Are They Now? – our ongoing tabs on the youthful team of Brisbane private school boys who helped build Blue Sky Alternative Investments on quicksand, then wailed while it sank.

Back in March, Blue Sky’s disgraced former chief executive Rob Shand set up his own consulting firm, called Edinglassie – the name Brisbane was almost given in 1824. Business development must be somewhat trying when your website is password-protected. Safe to say Shandy hasn’t taken too many client accounts from McKinsey or Bain. At least he’s still got his pony ranch. Does Morgans analyst Scott “Scooter” Murdoch come in on Saturdays to sweep out the stalls?

More recently, Blue Sky’s redundant chief investment officer (and a member of the board) Alex McNab has set up VSB Advisory, which offers such services as “helping you find targets to acquire” (so flicking through Dr Elaine Stead’s favourite shoe shops), “sourcing equity capital” (read: calling Morgans), “identifying short term cash levers” (read: calling Oaktree) and “execution support” (for companies in need of a cyanide cap or the electric chair).

Another Blue Sky board alumnus (and its head of growth capital) Nick Dignam has established Fortitude Investment Partners with his former team members at the Enron of Eagle Street, Nick Miller, Bryan Brown and Sam O’Connor. And fortitude is what you’d need in spades to entrust them with a dime of your hard earned.

Then there’s Blue Sky’s head of real estate, Edan Norris, now flogging a five lot residential subdivision in beautiful Yamanto, on the St Marys side of Ipswich. Pitiable. To his credit, Edan’s appetite for cheapjack property flips is not the exclusive preserve of his sorry career.
description: Blue Sky's valedictorians have moved onto VSB Advisory, Fortitude Investment Partners and even a subdivision in the back blocks of Yamanto.
